      • NaiveBayes

    • Method Detail

      • train

        public void train(java.lang.String trainingFile)
        This method reads and processes the training file. The probability of the p(no) and p(yes) is calculated in this method.
        Parameters:
        trainingFile - This should be args[0] from the main method. This parameter is the name of the file we are going to read in the training data from.

      • getMean

        public double getMean(int index,
                      boolean outcome)
        Finds the mean of a given attribute and certain outcome.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the attribute we want to find the mean of. The values must be between [0, 7]
        outcome - true for class yes, false for class no.
        Returns:
        returns the mean calculated.

      • getStdDeviation

        public double getStdDeviation(int index,
                              boolean outcome)
        This method is used to find the standard deviation of a particular attribute, given an outcome.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the attribute we want to find the standard deviation of. The values must be between [0, 7].
        outcome - true for class yes, false for class no.
        Returns:
        returns the standard deviation calculated.

      • run

        public void run(java.lang.String test)
        The method processes the data given in the file, whose name is specified by the parameter. It will attempt to predict whether the class outcome is yes or no and prints it to standard output.
        Parameters:
        test - is the file name of the file we are going to test.

      • pdf

        public static double pdf(double x,
                         double u,
                         double sigma)
        This method applies the probability distribution function to the values x, u, and sigma.
        Parameters:
        x - The value we are applying the function to.
        u - The average.
        sigma - The standard deviation.
        Returns:
        The result of applying the probability distribution distribution function to x given u(the average) and sigma(the standard deviation).

      • getMean

        public double getMean(int index)
        This method calculates the average of the values at a given index.
        Parameters:
        index - Is the index of the values we are using for to find the mean.
        Returns:
        The mean of the data in the training set.

      • getStdDeviation

        public double getStdDeviation(int index)
        calculates the standard deviation of the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of values for which we want to find the standard deviation. must be between [0, 7]. Otherwise undefined behaviour results. Undefined behaviour results if the index is not valid.
        Returns:
        returns the standard deviation for the index we desire.
